Galio, hands down. He's so stoic and majestic looking.

https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/005/263/601/large/gem-lim-galio-vu-concept-refine10.jpg?1489721945
New Galio is so beautiful, I understood people missed his old design, but his new one is just amazing.

I personally think his new art design is as good if not better than the old one, especially because it lets him be made of petricite and have better thematic cohesion with Demacia. Most people who hate new Galio do so because of the gameplay changes they made. They turned him from a tanky mage into a magey tank, then decided his tank aspects were too strong so made him back into a mage, then decided that was too strong and now the character is basically dead.

If they did a gameplay revert on Galio with the new art intact I don't think people would be sad.

{{champion:203}} , although the story of Azir and Xerath is also enjoyable.

I disagree that gameplay doesn't matter. There are characters that I like artistically, but when a character's aesthetics and personality are in harmony with their gameplay feel, that adds another level of enjoyment for me. Personally such champions are:

{{champion:81}}  He is an arrogant, bishonen jerk that is constantly on the move and annoys those he has exchanges with: His art design is pretty bland and it follows his theme as a charismatic yet self-centered explorer. His gameplay is also in line with his identity, since he is skill based, slippery, and there's nothing more annoying than an IBG Ez

{{champion:268}}  Basically the champion that best represents Shurima and his design drawing inspiration from the god Horus is a great design choice considering the general Egyptian inspiration for Shurima. On top of that, his gameplay perfectly simulates the feeling of being a powerful commanding presence that also dives into action when needed.

{{champion:28}} / {{champion:19}} I am pitting them together because they are such successful designs that follow similar paths: They both sell the feeling of being a predator each in their own way, one by ambushing you, luring you in and finishing you off, the other by sniffing you out and running you down relentlessly. Prob my favorites

{{champion:83}}

Even his name is on point with a reference to Shakespeare's Hamlet (and tied to death too). Truly majestic

{{champion:516}}  I really just love the way he's designed. His theme of being a fiery, forge god is well executed, I love his VO, and he just feels fluffy just from looking at him.

{{champion:82}} The rework did an amazing job of making him feel more unique and still menacing. The mace is massive, the armor is well designed, I just love this look for him.

{{champion:202}} He's just a perfect blend of psychopathic killer and artist.

anyway, dont know it I already said so, but Kled. he embodies everything about the Noxian bravado successfully, while having gone insane from isolation has perverted Noxian expansion into a mindset that everything he sees is his and his alone while making bravado suicidal. finally, Skaarl brings it together by juxtaposing Kled, being the coward that will run when things are too much (and being vague if this is due to Kled's spiritual influence of embodying  Noxus bravado), but also showing the friendship and loyalty that can form when you fight for Noxus

by far my favorite line from Sion. the delivery, especially when you've been hearing his combat lines of relishing violence, is just perfect.

It's a battle between :{{champion:99}}  & {{champion:518}} ! But if I had to choose it would be Neeko; she's just such a fun champ. She's colorful, she fits the "rift" look, she's fun, she's curious, and her skill set is a blast to play with. You can't really say anything negative about Neeko. It's one of the newer champs Riot didn't just fart out and that I actually like.
{{champion:202}} Jhin for sure. Everything about him is just perfection. His design, his lore, his abilities, his skins. It's all perfect.
